post.description:
Resets retry attempt counters on failed (optionally also completed) outputs and they will be subsequently picked up for re-rendering.
The number the counters are reset to is determined by a global configuration value.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Timeout to wait for completion, operation will continue regardless.

requestBody.description: Request containing options to filter which outputs should be reset.

BusinessProcessWaitForLifeCycleResult.description: Result from waiting for life cycle(s) on a business process

lifeCycleHit.description: The life cycle that was hit.

BusinessProcessLifeCycle.description: Life cycle of the business process

processDefinitionId.description: ID of the business process definition associated to the business process.

referenceId.description: ID of the document that is modified by the running of the business process. Used during the cancellation of the business process.

referenceDocType.description: Type of the document that is modified by the running of the business process. Used during the cancellation of the business process.

supportsCancellation.description: True if the business process execution can be cancelled. False otherwise.

lifeCycle.description: Current life cycle of the business process.

stateHistory.description: List containing the history of all the state transitions of the business process.

currentState.description: Current state of the business process.

lastReportedProgress.description: Timestamp when the business process last reported progress.

continuationBusinessProcessId.description: Id of the business process that will be automatically started after the completion of the current one, if any.

timestamp.description: Date and time of when the state transition was performed.

error.description: Eventual error associated to the state transition.

response.description: The response of the batch operation.

error.description: If the operation did not succeed, this contains error information.

requestId.description: The identifier provided by user in the corresponding request (or null if none was provided). Used only in bulk creation.

error.description: If the operation did not succeeded, this contains error related information.

affectedUserId.description: The ID of the inactive or deleted user in question.

aggregationSize.description: The invalid size of the aggregation: size must be equal or greater than 1.

referenceItemId.description: This is the source of the reference.

exceptions.description: These exceptions describe why the source metadata item could not be updated.

contentId.description: Content for which a change to RequestedContentSchemaId would cause data loss

requestedContentSchemaId.description: ContentSchemaId to which the Content would have been changed

incompatibleLayerAssignments.description: Layers assigned to this Content which are not allowed for contents of type RequestedContentSchemaId

allOf.description: Search result from a search for business processes
Base class for search result queries that support SearchBehaviors

aggregationResults.description: Results of the aggregation, if any aggregators was passed in the request.

sumOtherDocCount.description: When there are lots of unique terms, Elastic Search only returns the top terms; this number is the sum of the document counts for all buckets that are not part of the response.

aggregationResultItems.description:
Items returned for the aggregation. Each item consists of a bucket with the matched value and the number of matches.
Optionally inner aggregations for further drill down can be available.

filter.description:
Ready to use filter to filter the data based on the aggregation result values.
It can be passed as one of the aggregation filters of an aggregation query: it returns documents meeting the aggregation condition.

active.description: True if the current result item matches on of the aggregation filters sent in the query.

aggregationResults.description: Inner aggregation results, if inner aggregations were provided in the query.

detail.description: Detailed information about the aggregation result item.

allOf.description: Filters aggregations

aggregationName.description: The name of the aggregation this filter is connected to.

temporaryAggregatorRequestId.description: Autogenerated Guid at request time, for precise aggregation result mapping.

allOf.description: Put filters in "or"

allOf.description: Base class for search result queries that support SearchBehaviors

searchString.description: The search string used to query the data.

isSearchStringRewritten.description: Flag to notify if the SearchString was modified compared to the original requested one.

queryDebugInformation.description: Additional information regarding the query execution and reason of the matched documents. Multiple items are returned if multiple queries were performed.

totalResults.description: The total number of matching documents.

elapsedMilliseconds.description: The search execution time in milliseconds.

pageToken.description: An optional token to access the next page of results for those endpoints that support backend scrolling logic.

BusinessProcessSearchRequest.description: Search request to search for business processes

limit.description: Limits the document count of the result set.

pageToken.description: The token used to retrieve the next page of results. It must be null on first request and only filled with the returned pageToken to request next page of results.

filter.description: An optional search filter. Limits the document result set.

searchString.description: Limits the search by using a query string filter. The Lucene query string syntax is supported.

searchBehaviors.description: An optional list of search behaviors. All the passed behaviors will be applied.

debugMode.description:
Enable debug mode: additional debug information regarding the query execution and reason of the matched documents are returned in the BusinessProcessSearchResult.
Warning! It severely affects performance.

aggregationFilters.description:
Special filters used to filter down independently the aggregations' values and the search results on specific conditions.
For the search results, the aggregation filters are used to create a Filter that is put in AND with the eventual existing Filter of the search request to nail down the search results. The filters generated
by the aggregation filters are put in OR each other if they have the same AggregationName, and then such groups are put in AND.
For the aggregation values, only the original Filter of the search request is used to nail down the data to be considered for the aggregations. Then, on top of that, for each aggregator in the search request, a Filter is created to filter down the
aggregation results of that aggregation: depending if the AggregationName of the AggregationFilter matches the AggregationName of the Aggregator, the filter is put in OR (if it matches) or in AND (if it does not match it).
Moreover, an AggregationFilter ensures that the related value is returned in the AggregationResults also if the top aggregation values returned by default do not contain it.

aggregators.description: List of aggregators that defines how the items should be aggregated.

sort.description: Fields and respective directions requested to sort the search results. Sorting on a not indexed field will throw an exception.

AggregatorBase.description: It is the base class for all aggregators.

name.description: The slug name of the aggregation. It must be unique per aggregation request.

aggregators.description: An optional aggregator list for nested aggregations.

filter.description: An optional filter to limit the data set the aggregation is operation on.

uiBehavior.description: Optional behavior that the UI should keep in regards to the aggregation

UiAggregatorBehavior.description: Behavior that the UI should keep in regards to the aggregation

enableFilter.description: Filters should be enabled in the UI.

enableSuggestions.description: Suggestions should be enabled in the UI.

enableSearchInFilter.description: Search functionality should be enabled in the filters in the UI.

field.description: The field's ID to execute the aggregation on.

ranges.description: A list of date time ranges.

from.description: The from value: it can be a datetime string or a pattern now(+-)(int)(YMDHm).

to.description: The to value: it can be a datetime string or a pattern now(+-)(int)(YMDHm).

allOf.description: A multi-bucket value aggregator

size.description: It defines how many term buckets should be returned out of the overall terms list.

includes.description: Includes values for which buckets will be created. Supports regular expression strings or arrays of exact values.

excludes.description: Excludes values for which buckets will be created. Supports regular expression strings or arrays of exact values.

searchString.description: Limits the possible returned aggregation values by using a query string filter. The Lucene query string syntax is supported.

Path to get buckets for.

size.description: The size parameter can be set to define how many buckets should be returned out of the overall list.

snapshotName.description:
The SnapshotName. Must be unique.
The name usually will be enriched with Reason, ContractVersion and DateTime information.

repositoryName.description: The Repository in which the snapshot will be created.

indices.description: The Indices being part of the snapshot.

snapshotInactive.description: Snapshot also if the entity is inactive.

reason.description: The snapshot backup reason will be added to the snapshot name.

timestamp.description:
Timestamp when creating the request (utc). If there is a more recent snapshot in the repository, it will keep/return the latest one,
instead of creating a new one.

expires.description: Time at which the repository becomes eligible for cleanup

endTime.description: Only populated when all snapshots have finished

refillRecreatedSecondaryIndices.description: Defines whether secondary indices which are missing for customer are filled or left empty

recreateSearchIndicesCluster.description:
Defines where searchIndices are recreated if they did not exist (not part of restored snapshot, for example)
If null, searchIndices will be recreated on the cluster they were on when the snapshot was taken (or, if that cluster does not exist, on the default)

certificate.description: Data to use when creating or updating the certificate

missingRepositories.description: List of repositories that were used in the repositories filter, but were not found in the system.

start.description: Start of the blocking period. It must be before End.

end.description: End of the blocking period. It must be after Start.

isLocked.description: A locked user is not allowed to log in.

isSupportUser.description: A support user is a user created for Picturepark support personnel.

isReadOnly.description: Read-only users can't be removed from the system, e.g. service user.

isFederated.description: Federated user is a user who is (currently) governed by an external identity provider.

isAnonymousUser.description: Anonymous user is the automatically logged in user if public access is allowed.

valueToRemove.description: Existing boost value that is going to be removed.

valueToReplaceWith.description: Boost value that is going to replace the removed one where it was used.

boostValuesToAdd.description: List of boost values that need to be added to the existing ones.

boostValuesToRemove.description: List of existing boost values that need to be removed.

targetSiloName.description: Target silo name, must be configured in the cloud.

copySiloContents.description: Specifies if contents of currently configured silo should be copied to new silo.

force.description:
Start the operation even though another one is already running for the same customer.
Cancels all currently running operations.

allOf.description: Provides possibility to respect internal interactivity request but only for a limited number of messages in parallel

attachResultAsTag.description: Adds result of this model to the enqueued message

ignoreIncomingTag.description: Whether an attached result from AttachResultAsTag> should be used as result

maxWeight.description: ModelResults are considered as long as their cumulative weight is at or below this value

modelWeights.description: Weights to be used for model results (if they were produced). Results with undefined weights are ignored.

contractVersion.description: The contract version of the environment configuration.

lifeCycle.description: Curent lifecycle state of the entity.

VersionInfo.description: The version view item for the environment.

fileVersion.description: The manual file version of Picturepark.Contract.dll.

fileProductVersion.description: The GitVersionTask generated file product version of Picturepark.Configuration.dll.

contractVersion.description: The current contract version stored in CustomerDoc / EnvironmentDoc.

start.description: Defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Defaults to 0.

limit.description: Limits the document count of the result set. Defaults to 30.

contentIds.description: List of Content IDs you want to filter on.

outputFormatIds.description: The IDs of the output formats you want to filter on.

includeCompleted.description: Should the successful filter results also be reset (and subsequently re-rendered)?

contentIds.description: List of Content IDs you want to filter on.

outputFormatIds.description: The IDs of the output formats you want to filter on.

createdBefore.description: Set to filter on creation date.

createdAfter.description: Set to filter on creation date.

skipHashCalculation.description: Skip hash calculation (only fix file size)

events.description: Data to be added to statistics

timestamp.description: Specifies at which time the events happened. The information will be automatically aggregated according to internal temporal resolution of statistics.

contentId.description: Specifies content for which the events happened

apiClientId.description: Optionally specify the used ApiClient. Defaults to the API Client sending this request.

statistics.description: Data to be added to statistics

externalEventTraceId.description:
Optionally specify an additional id under which the supplied data should be tracked. This
Id is only used internally and cannot be retrieved through API or export.

downloads.description: Statistical data for downloads of a Content

total.description: Total downloads of content (regardless of formats, single download of multiple formats is counted once)

share.description: Downloads of content through basic Share

creationDate.description: The date on which the document was created.

modificationDate.description: The last date on which the document was modified.

createdByUser.description: ID of the user who created the document.

modifiedByUser.description: ID of the last user who modified the document.

UpdateInfo.description: Contains information about a possibly available update

updateVersion.description: The maximum version available to update to.

updateAvailable.description: Indicates if an update is available.

targetVersion.description:
The maximal target version.
In case the highest available update version is lower than the desired target version, the environments's contract version will be raised to the highest available update version.

allOf.description: The version view item for the customer.

targetVersion.description:
The maximal target version.
In case the highest available update version is lower than the desired target version, the customer's contract version will be raised to the highest available update version.

refillRecreatedSecondaryIndices.description: Defines whether secondary indices which are missing for customer are filled or left empty

recreateSearchIndicesCluster.description:
Defines where searchIndices are recreated if they did not exist (not part of restored snapshot, for example)
If null, searchIndices will be recreated on the cluster they were on when the snapshot was taken (or, if that cluster does not exist, on the default)

allOf.description: Meta information for a dynamic view field

filter.description: Filter for the dynamic view field.

DynamicViewFieldMetaBase.description: Base class of meta information for a dynamic view field

allOf.description: Meta information for a dynamic view field including a flag that indicates if the rendered filter does match some items.

hasItems.description: indicates if the rendered filter does match some items.

allOf.description: Meta information for a dynamic view field where the filter could not be rendered successfully.
